intro: Hieracium abortiens, commonly known as the aborted hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture and hairy surfaces, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium abortiens is often found in open habitats and can sometimes be invasive in certain regions.
